content:
Why did you make x the vertical and y the horizontal?

I got stuck debugging this for ages before I was able to figure it out, in-clash.

It's quite confusing to swap the standard meaning of x and y, and I'm not sure what the logic is here? At the least it would be good to put the line that mentions this in <<bold>>. I am editing the statement to do so now.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution, because it is a fun riddle to solve and even though it seems tricky at first, it's actually really easy.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Because it is a good riddle fun to solve and doable even though it seems a little bit tricky at first.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it is a fun problem, in which the solution is mostly easy to code but you have to think to get to this solution. It combines coding with problem-solving in a nice and harmonic way.

Goal
* 1st sentence: "2 points X" looks confusing to me. Suggest to either delete X, or add "and [[Y]]".

* 2nd sentence: Please change "Each cell that is not a point will print" to "Print", and then add "at each cell that is not a point" to the end of the sentence.

* Please change "manhattan" to "Manhattan" (twice).

* 3rd sentence: Suggest to delete "index-based(!)-".

* Please state how the coordinate system works:

   • Where is the origin (0, 0)?

   • Towards which direction do x-coordinates increase?

   • Towards which direction do y-coordinates increase?

* Please format "X", "1", "2" and "0" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* Last sentence: Please change "of the subtraction" to "function".

Input
* Please change "y 2" to "y2".

Constraints
* Please add a constraint on x1, y1, x2, y2:

0 ≤ [[x1]], [[y1]], [[x2]], [[y2]] ≤ 100

Thanks.

Your comments and suggestions are highly appreciated, thank you.
I tried to incooperate your notes. Please feel free to let me know whether you think that the changes are sufficient.

There really isn't any specific reason to it and I now understand how this is  probably counter-intuituve to most users.
Thank you for editing the statement already. Do you think it would be a good idea to change the puzzle as well so that x is the horizontal and y the verical axis?

I'm not sure whether it's a good idea to change it now.

Once a puzzle is approved, it's generally not a good idea to change anything that would break old solutions, one reason is that the CodinGame bots use old solutions.

I think it's best to just keep it this way now, but I kind of just needed to vent, haha. Hopefully now that it's bold less people will get trapped like I did.
Fair :^) Thanks for pointing it out though, I will certainly keep it in mind for future contributions.

Thank you for the quick follow-up!

I would suggest one small change only: change Absolute(xxxx) to Absolute value(xxxx) in the formula.

Thanks.
